page.title: 13TOURISM
page.content: The{Church}is a popular tourist attraction. The visitors' book reveals visitors have come from many parts of the world. Parts of the Church date back to the early thirteenth century. In an earlier Priest's room James Sibbald, Vicar of Arbuthnott, wrote the famous{Missal of Arbuthnott,}now in the Art Gallery and Museum at Paisley. Unfortunately, a fire in 1890 destroyed some of the earlier buildings. The Church is now in good repair and used for Church of Scotland services.{Lewis Grassic Gibbon}(James Leslie Mitchell), auther of Sunset Song is buried in the churchyard. Bloomfield, on the Riesk Road, where he lived as a child, is just out of our block. Beside the{River Bervie, near the Church, is a popular pic-nic spot, and at Easter numerous eggs have been rolled.
